body:
Attempting to install cmake@3.17.0%gcc@9.2.0 on Cray (in this case, CLE7 on x86_64) resulted in Spack trying to pull libraries from gcc@8.3.0.  Relevant info:

```
sly@tt-fey1:~> spack compiler info gcc@9.2.0
gcc@9.2.0:
        paths:
                cc = cc
                cxx = CC
                f77 = ftn
                fc = ftn
        environment:
            set:
                HUGETLB_VERBOSE = 0
        modules  = ['PrgEnv-gnu', 'gcc/9.2.0']
        operating system  = cnl7
sly@tt-fey1:~> module show gcc/9.2.0
-------------------------------------------------------------------
/opt/modulefiles/gcc/9.2.0:
conflict         gcc 
conflict         gcc-cross-aarch64 
prepend-path     PATH /opt/gcc/9.2.0/bin 
prepend-path     MANPATH /opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/share/man 
prepend-path     INFOPATH /opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/share/info 
prepend-path     LD_LIBRARY_PATH /opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/lib64 
setenv           GCC_PATH /opt/gcc/9.2.0 
setenv           GCC_PREFIX /opt/gcc/9.2.0 
setenv           GCC_VERSION 9.2.0 
setenv           GNU_VERSION 9.2.0 
-------------------------------------------------------------------
```

The relevant environment lines from the cmake build:
```
SPACK_COMPILER_IMPLICIT_RPATHS=/opt/gcc/8.3.0/snos/lib/gcc/x86_64-suse-linux/8.3.0:/opt/gcc/8.3.0/snos/lib64; export SPACK_COMPILER_IMPLICIT_RPATHS
SPACK_COMPILER_SPEC=gcc@9.2.0; export SPACK_COMPILER_SPEC
SPACK_LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/cray/job/2.2.4-7.0.1.1_3.32__g36b56f4.ari/lib64:/opt/gcc/8.3.0/snos/lib64:/opt/intel/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/lib/intel64:/opt/intel/2019.4.070/compilers_and_libraries_2019/linux/mkl/lib/intel64; export SPACK_LD_LIBRARY_PATH
```

And the GCC information with that compiler loaded is:
```
sly@tt-fey1:~> module swap gcc/9.2.0
sly@tt-fey1:~> gcc -v
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=/opt/gcc/9.2.0/bin/../snos/bin/gcc
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/libexec/gcc/x86_64-suse-linux/9.2.0/lto-wrapper
Target: x86_64-suse-linux
Configured with: ../cray-gcc-9.2.0-201912180810.12613f2d08876/configure --prefix=/opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos --disable-nls --libdir=/opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/lib --enable-languages=c,c++,fortran --with-gxx-include-dir=/opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/include/g++ --with-slibdir=/opt/gcc/9.2.0/snos/lib --with-system-zlib --enable-shared --enable-__cxa_atexit --build=x86_64-suse-linux --with-ppl --with-cloog --disable-multilib
Thread model: posix
gcc version 9.2.0 20190812 (Cray Inc.) (GCC)
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install cmake@3.17.0%gcc@9.2.0
```

### Error Message

```console
/tmp/sly/spack-stage/spack-stage-cmake-3.17.0-zxi2iwpzdutegg3cjuzevinmjsc4nice/spack-src/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake: /opt/gcc/8.3.0/snos/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.26' not found (required by /tmp/sly/spack-stage/spack-stage-cmake-3.17.0-zxi2iwpzdutegg3cjuzevinmjsc4nice/spack-src/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake)
---------------------------------------------
Error when bootstrapping CMake:
Problem while running initial CMake
---------------------------------------------
```

### Information on your system

```
sly@tt-fey1:~> spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-700-395e91d62
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-x86_64
```

The build uses the cray-provided modules for compilers and cray-mpich.  The environment variable `HUGETLB_VERBOSE=0` is there to solve another CMake build issue.

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: Generating incorrect implicit rpaths for gcc on Cray
